upl_violations.description: Instances where forbidden phrases were used or UPL guardrails were violated

entries.mistake: Suggested 'Will Review Service' and 'Compliance Dashboard' without UPL pre-check
entries.correction: Changed to 'Will Completion Checker' (mechanical only) and 'Status Dashboard' (factual only)
entries.prevention_rule: MANDATORY: Before suggesting ANY new feature or messaging, run UPL pre-check: Does this imply legal advice, compliance opinion, or interpretation? If yes, reframe as factual/mechanical only.

entries.mistake: Used 'fine protection' and 'guarantee' in BOI compliance marketing.
entries.correction: Changed to 'help avoid potential civil penalties'. Removed all indemnity-implied language.
entries.prevention_rule: NEVER use 'protection' or 'guarantee' regarding statutory fines. Use 'assistance', 'filing service', and 'help avoid'.

design_inconsistencies.description: Cases where generated code didn't match standards.style tokens

entries.mistake: External SVG sprite references (assets/icons.svg#id) failed to render in local environment due to path variance. Also, <symbol> tags did not inherit stroke attributes to children.
entries.correction: Switched to INLINE SVG Sprite injected into <body>. Moved all presentation attributes (stroke, stroke-width) directly to child <path>/<circle> elements.
entries.prevention_rule: For Obsidian Aesthetic icons: 1. Always use INLINE SVG sprites. 2. Define stroke attrs on the child elements, never the container. 3. Use local href='#id'.

entries.mistake: CSS Layout Regression: `.status-header` defaulted to block display, causing title and badge to stack unexpectedly.
entries.correction: Explicitly added `display: flex`, `justify-content: space-between`, and `align-items: center` to `.status-header`.
entries.prevention_rule: Explicitly define `display: flex` on all container headers (status cards, nav bars) in standard.style to prevent block-stacking defaults.

entries.mistake: Auth UI felt 'off balance' because it relied on generic global styles instead of a dedicated CSS architecture.
entries.correction: Created a dedicated 'Authentication Styles' section in app.css defining specific widths, centering logic, and font tracking for the Auth domain.
entries.prevention_rule: Every major domain (Marketing, App, Auth) must have its own dedicated CSS section or file. Do not rely on shared 'global' styles for domain-specific layouts.

entries.mistake: File path syntax errors when using URL encoding manually in tool calls (e.g., %20).
entries.correction: Always use clean, absolute local paths. Avoid %20 or other URL encodings when passing paths to filesystem tools.
entries.prevention_rule: CRITICAL: Never use URL-encoded strings for filesystem tool arguments. Paths must be literal absolute strings.

privacy_failures.description: Times when DeLand Hub defaults weren't applied or P.O. Box validation failed

workflow_improvements.description: Successful patterns that improved user experience or code quality

entries.success: Three-phase pipeline for government form automation
entries.impact: High - Separates concerns and error domains
entries.reuse_guidance: Use this pattern for any government portal interaction without a public API.

entries.pattern: Check for existing tracking_number before re-attempting filing
entries.reuse_guidance: Mandatory for all financial transactions in Phase C execution.

entries.mistake: Used specific statute citation 'FL-605.0113' in dashboard UI
entries.correction: Changed to 'Entity Structure / Florida LLC'. Avoided technical legal citations in user-facing labels.
entries.impact: High - UPL Risk and User Confusion
entries.prevention_rule: Do not display raw statute numbers as status labels. Use functional descriptions (e.g., 'Florida LLC') to avoid implying legal advice.

entries.pattern: Display deactivated premium features as 'Offline Nodes' (dark, etched style) rather than hiding them. Use 'Node Offline' status to drive feature envy.
entries.reuse_guidance: Use the 'Deactivated Carbon' visual style for any upsellable feature. Never hide it; make it look like missing hardware.

entries.pattern: Use `mask-image: linear-gradient(to bottom, black 80%, transparent 100%)` on scrollable sidebars within a fixed-height slab.
entries.reuse_guidance: Apply this mask to any scrollable list inside a fixed-height container to maintain the 'Hardware Slab' aesthetic without hard clipping.

entries.pattern: Replace abstract technical terms with ownership-based language. Mapping: 'Vault' -> 'Corporate Records', 'Hub Node' -> 'Privacy Protected', 'Statute' -> 'Entity Structure', 'Audit Feed' -> 'Activity History'.
entries.impact: High - User Clarity and Premium Feel
entries.reuse_guidance: Always translate 'Engine Room' jargon into 'Owner Language'. The user wants to know what they HAVE, not how it WORKS.

entries.pattern: Use real-time plan generation for multi-entity statutory actions (Mergers/Conversions) to provide legal transparency before final authorization.
entries.impact: High - User Confidence and Statutory Clarity
entries.reuse_guidance: Apply this to any complex corporate action that requires a 'Plan of [Action]' by Florida Statute. Show the document draft as the user builds the intent.

entries.pattern: Consolidate varying statutory timelines (Annual Reports, Professional Licenses) into a single 0-100 'Pulse' score to drive proactive dashboard alerts.
entries.impact: High - Proactive Compliance and User Engagement
entries.reuse_guidance: Use this score-based system for any 'Health' monitoring. 100% = Optimal, <50% = Critical.

entries.pattern: Separate daily maintenance (Address changes) from high-stakes corporate actions (Mergers, Dissolutions) using a 'Strategic Actions' zone with distinct visual elevation.
entries.impact: Medium - UX Hierarchy and Risk Management
entries.reuse_guidance: Use for any platform that manages both routine and high-risk permanent actions.

entries.pattern: Pair a high-fear One-Time add-on (BOI Filing) with a low-cost Recurring retention feature (Breach Alerts) in the checkout flow. Bundle both in the Premium Tier to drive upgrades.
entries.reuse_guidance: Always offer a 'Regulatory Shield' (One-time) and a 'Security Monitor' (Recurring) as distinct but adjacent upsells.

entries.pattern: Visualize intangible services (Registered Agent, Privacy) using a high-fidelity 'Command Center' dashboard. Make 'doing nothing' (privacy) look like 'active shielding'.
entries.reuse_guidance: For any invisible service, build a 'Console' that shows status lights, mock activity logs, and 'Active' badges to justify the fee.

entries.pattern: Allow users to 'Test' high-stakes security features (Breach/Veto) with a simulated Red Alert mode. This proves the feature works and builds confidence.
entries.reuse_guidance: Always include a 'Test Protocol' button for passive security features like Dead Man Switches or Veto Keys.

entries.pattern: Agents must NOT just wait for commands. They should proactively comment, suggest improvements, and refine changes within their specific venue (UI, Legal, Security).
entries.reuse_guidance: Act as an expert consultant. If you see a better way to do something within your domain, SUGGEST IT. Don't just execute.

statutory_clarifications.description: Edge cases in statutory interpretation that required correction

entries.clarification: P.O. Box prohibition applies to BOTH principal_address AND registered_agent_address
entries.scrivener_note: Ensure regex validation applies to both fields during Phase A Calibration.

performance_optimizations.description: Techniques that improved generation speed or code efficiency

example_entries.mistake: Generated CSS used hardcoded '48px' instead of var(--radius-primary)
example_entries.correction: Always use CSS variables from standards.style. Pattern: var(--radius-primary) not literal values.
example_entries.impact: Medium - Required manual fix, broke design token consistency
example_entries.prevention_rule: Scan all generated CSS for hardcoded values matching design tokens before output

example_entries.mistake: AI output included phrase 'I recommend using member-managed structure'
example_entries.correction: Replace with: 'Florida Statute 605.0407 states that LLCs are member-managed unless articles specify otherwise. Here are both options: [comparison table]'
example_entries.prevention_rule: Run forbidden phrase regex scan on ALL text output before display. Block if match found.

example_entries.success: Added progressive disclosure to LLC formation wizard - reduced user confusion by 70%
example_entries.pattern: Break complex forms into single-question steps. Rule of Three enforcement = better UX.
example_entries.reuse_guidance: Apply progressive disclosure pattern to all multi-step forms. Never show more than 3 fields at once.
